column4: I have set up RAID 1 (using nvidia onboard controller) and have installed the gutsy. However, i can't set the raid array to boot (there is an option but it's grayed out) and the system won't boot. any suggestions?
nvidia's controllers are wha'ts called fake-raid controllers.
does that change how i should set it up
or explain why it's not working?
is ubuntu's setup seeing the array?
during install it sees sda and sdb but no mention of raid - should there be?
a true raid controller would only be showing sda ...
short of buying a true raid controller, is there a simple way to make this work? i just want a mirror for backup
software raid
meaning i should scrap the nvidia raid, set up normally and then install software raid? or would i still keep the nvidia setup set up?
scrap the nvraid stuff.  during setup you can set up software raid fairly quick and painless

shoot. i was hoping the nvidia stuff would be simple and cool - just doing it in the background. okay, are you saying that while installing gutsy i can also set up software raid? i've never seen an option for that.
it's on the alternate cd
is that the only way or can i install normally and then add the raid stuff afterwards? seeing as how it's already installed and i don't have the alternate cd :)
you won't be able to add it later because it requires certain type of partitions...

okay. guess i'll be downloading the alternate cd. one last question, is the software raid an okay way to go? i mean is it relatively stable and problem free running in the background or will i need to "mess" with it a lot?
i've got a headless server with 3 disks in software raid5... been stable for a year now
software raid is done in the background by the linux kernel... so if the kernel's relatively stable... then so will your raid :)
cool. thanks for the help. i guess the raid controller on my edubuntu server at work is a fancy hardware controller. should have known that a $200 mobo wouldn't have the same
most sata raid chipsets aren't true raid.
i suppose you would need to buy a fancy controller. i'll go software and see what happens
